title: Why Ken Burns Doesn't Use Siri; The filmmaker, 69, whose book "Our America: A Photographic History" is out November 1, shares what's on his phone.
text:
First app checked in the morning

Email, especially [historian] Heather Cox Richardson's letter and a group that responds to Tolstoy's daily A Calendar of Wisdom.

Last app checked at night

ESPN scores before I go to bed.

Person you FaceTime the most

Persons: my four daughters.

Most-listened-to album

The Beatles' Abbey Road on Sirius XM.

Siri user?

No, Putin and Xi might be listening too.

Most-essential travel app

Flight Update Pro.

App you wish someone would invent

There are enough apps.

Funniest recent text message

A movie of two of my grandkids goofing around.

Number of contacts

8,000-plus contacts. 17,600 photographs, and thousands more have been off-loaded.

Biggest time-wasting app

Solitaire.

Alarm setting

I always wake up before any alarm I set.

Cities listed in weather app

Eighteen towns and cities including Walpole, NH; Minneapolis; New York City; D.C.; Chicago; New Orleans; Boston; San Francisco; Los Angeles; Atlanta; Denver; Telluride, CO; Seattle; Castellina in Chianti, Italy; Guerneville, CA; Paris; Martha's Vineyard; Deerfield, MA.

Favorite food-related app

Shake Shack.

Craziest place you've lost your phone

Dropped in the lakeâ€”retrieved by a diver friend.
